column4: in fstab file there isn't an option to enable the mount as an user id... uid or guid options... can I mount an ext3 partition as a normal user?
what do you want to do?
I want to access at partition through samba from windows
but what is the problem with that?
During the boot, the partition was mount as root so I'm not able to access and modify the data...
do you want to share the whole partition or a folder on it
I want to share a partition
then chmod the partition to the right mode and chown it to the user and group you want to grant access to
then change the owner of that partition and set access permissions accordingly
in the most basic and most insecure case, just do a "sudo chown -Rv 777 mount-point" while the partition is mounted to the mount point
and Dr_Willis: thank you very much!
so when the chmod is used on mount points of ext3 partitions these are mounted and owned during every boot by the same owner?
the partition is NOT owned, any part of it can be owned for example to root of a partition can be owned by root and files under the root directory by may people
yes, I make a little confusion, I'm sorry...
im sorry that my explanation might be a bit awkward and vague but the permissions to files in the ext3 partition have NOTHING to do with the mounting process
